text: Pre-Statehood Trails of Michigan The Marquette Trail is the name for a historically important land route in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan between what is now Marquette, and the Keweenaw Bay near Baraga and L'Anse. Today this route is covered by two modern highways: * * ==See also== * ==References== Category:Historic trails and roads in Michigan Category:U.S. Route 41
title: Marquette Trail
